bookDetails: A masterpiece of psychological realism, this novel delves deep into the tortured mind of a young man who believes himself above morality, only to be consumed by guilt after committing a murder.
An epic exploration of faith, free will, and morality, this novel follows the troubled Karamazov brothers as they confront the death of their father and the existential chaos within themselves.
A haunting tale of alienation, Kafka's novella tells the story of Gregor Samsa, who wakes up one morning transformed into a giant insect and becomes a burden to his family.
Joseph K. finds himself arrested and prosecuted by a mysterious and inaccessible authority, in a surreal and nightmarish legal system that mirrors the absurdity of modern existence.
A semi-autobiographical account of a young woman's descent into mental illness, Sylvia Plath’s only novel poignantly captures the suffocating pressure of societal expectations on a fragile mind.
An intensely personal and emotionally raw novel that portrays the gradual disintegration of Oba Yozo’s identity as he tries to fit into a society that feels utterly alien to him.
A poignant collection of stories that explores isolation, despair, and human vulnerability through lyrical prose and deeply introspective characters.
A timeless Bengali classic portraying complex emotions of love, jealousy, and betrayal, centered around a young widow named Binodini who challenges societal norms.
A tragic tale of unfulfilled love, 'Devdas' captures the emotional agony of a man who turns to alcohol and self-destruction after being separated from his childhood love.
